snippet: In China, a spiritual hunger has taken hold even as physical hunger has receded.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Gerard Lemos, who says his months teaching and studying in Chinese communities offered him a glimpse of what is most on the minds of ordinary Chinese people; notes they are increasingly anxious about a host of worries but they mainly feel neglected by China's government, whose only concern seems to be the survival of its one-party system.
lead_paragraph: In China, a spiritual hunger has taken hold even as physical hunger has receded.

headline.seo: What Keeps the Chinese Up at Night
headline.main: What Keeps the Chinese Up at Night
headline.print_headline: What Keeps the Chinese Up at Night
